member.summary: An approximate parabolic fit. Results similar to the exact parabolic fit as long as the maximum is steep enough (i.e. not plateau shaped). Only usable with a 3x3 neighborhood.

member.summary: A full parabolic least squares fit.

member.summary: A Gaussian least squares fit.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Neighborhood
member.summary: Neighborhood to use in sub pixel calculation of local maxima. The bigger the neighborhood for calculation is, the longer the sub pixel fit will take.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Analyze.FindLocalMaxima(Stemmer.Cvb.ImagePlane,System.Int32,System.Double,Stemmer.Cvb.Rect)
member.summary: Find local maxima in the input image .
member.param: Image plane in which to look for maxima
Region of interest in which to look for maxima
Minimum distance between two valid maxima; if two maxima fall within this distance (measured using the L1 norm), the one with the lower gray value will be removed from the result list

Minimum gray value a local maximum must have for being reported. Note that the minimal possible value for the image's pixel type is never eligible to be a local maximum (e.g. if the image uses 8 bits per pixel unsigned, pixels with value 0 will never be a local maximum even if the threshold has been set to 0.
member.returns: List of the local maxima that have been found
member.exception: If the to work on has already been disposed

Minimum gray value a local maximum must have for being reported. Note that the minimal possible value for the image's pixel type is never eligible to be a local maximum (e.g. if the image uses 8 bits per pixel unsigned, pixels with value 0 will never be a local maximum even if the threshold has been set to 0.
member.returns: List of the local maxima that have been found
member.exception: If the to work on has already been disposed

member.summary: Find sub pixel accurate local maxima in the input image . Sub pixel accuracy is achieved by assuming a Gaussian or parabolic gray value distribution around a local maximum that can be fitted into the image data.
member.param: Image plane in which to look for maxima
Region of interest in which to look for maxima
Minimum distance between two valid maxima; if two maxima fall within this distance (measured using the L1 norm), the one with the lower gray value will be removed from the result list

Note that the minimal possible value for the image's pixel type is never eligible to be a local maximum (e.g. if the image uses 8 bits per pixel unsigned, pixels with value 0 will never be a local maximum even if the threshold has been set to 0.
Mode to be used for determining sub pixel accuracy (see description of values)
Neighborhood to take account in the sub pixel calculation (see description of values)
member.returns: List of the local maxima that have been found
member.exception: If the to work on has already been disposed
when trying to combine with a neighborhood other than

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.CoordinateSystemType
member.summary: Enumeration of the different available coordinate systems that an Area of interest may be defined in.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.CoordinateSystemType.PixelCoordinates
member.summary:
Pixel coordinates are defined as follows:
The distance from one pixel to the next in horizontal or vertical direction has a length of 1
The origin (0,0) is located in the top left corner of the image
The positive x axis points right, the positive y axis points down

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.CoordinateSystemType.ImageCoordinates
member.summary: The image coordinate system is defined by the property of the image and specifies an affine linear transformation from the pixel coordinate system to the image coordinate system. It is a right handed coordinate system: the positive y axis points "down", the positive x axis points right.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.IAreaOfInterest
member.summary: Base Interface for all areas of interest

member.summary: Implementers of this interface should specify here inside which coordinate system their Area of interest is to operate.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.IAreaOfInterest.Area
member.summary: Size (in pixels) of the Area of interest

member.summary: Async wrapper methods for objects.

member.summary: The task pool for CVB input wait methods.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Async.AcquisitionExtensions.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes the async manger to manage async operations.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Async.AcquisitionExtensions.GetSnapshotAsync(Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition)
member.summary: Acquires a single image and returns it.

remarks.para: The task waits infinitely for the image to be taken.
Attention: it is generally not possible to call this method while the acquisition has been started by .
Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.
This method uses an asynchronous wrapper to make asynchronous handling easier with the CVB acquisition engine. As a side effect using this interface is not as efficient as calling directly.

member.returns: Task to contain the grabbed image.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Async.AcquisitionExtensions.GetTimedSnapshotAsync(Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition,Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.UsTimeSpan)
member.summary: Acquires a single image and returns it.

remarks.para: Waits for the given for the image to be taken.
Attention: it is generally not possible to call this method while the acquisition has been started by .
Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.
This method uses an asynchronous wrapper to make asynchronous handling easier with the CVB acquisition engine. As a side effect using this interface is not as efficient as calling directly.

member.param: Time span to wait for (millisecond granularity).
member.returns: Task to contain the grabbed image.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Async.AcquisitionExtensions.WaitAsync(Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition)
member.summary: Waits infinitely for the next acquired image and returns it.

remarks.para: Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.
The returned image is not necessary the newest. If more images where acquired since the last call to this method, the content is the oldest not collected image buffer by default.
This method uses an asynchronous wrapper to make asynchronous handling easier with the CVB acquisition engine. As a side effect using this interface is not as efficient as calling directly.

member.returns: Task to contain the grabbed image.

This method uses an asynchronous wrapper to make asynchronous handling easier with the CVB acquisition engine. As a side effect using this interface is not as efficient as calling directly.

member.returns: Task to contain the grabbed image.

Parameter sensor size must be available in this calibrator in order to check the validity of the sensor ROI. A valid sensor ROI has to meet the following constraints:
left and top must be equal or greater zero
left and top must be smaller than the sensor size
difference between width and left must be equal or smaller than the width of the sensor(same for height and top

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Collections.Generic.CollectionExtensions.SeparateByQuality``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Double)
member.summary:
Makes sure the results in this list are separated by at least pixels (measured using the L1 norm). The separations is being carried out as follows:
First of all the list of results will be sorted by descending quality
Then the list will iterated from the element with the highest quality to the element with the lowest quality
For each element being iterated the distance to all subsequent list elements (i.e. those list elements with a lower quality) will be calculated; if it is less than the locality parameter, the element with the lower quality will be eliminated from the list
member.typeparam: type of the result comparable objects to be separated
member.param: collection to which to apply the separation
minimum distance between two results (must be > 0)

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Collections.Generic.CollectionExtensions.SeparatePositions``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Double)
member.summary:
Makes sure the results in this list are separated by at least pixels (measured using the L1 norm). The separations is being carried out as follows:
It is assumed that the list is already sorted "best to worst" according to whatever criterion is suitable
Then the list will iterated from the first element to the last element
For each element being iterated the distance to all subsequent list elements (i.e. those list elements with a lower quality) will be calculated; if it is less than the locality parameter, the element that came last will be eliminated from the list
member.typeparam: type of the result comparable objects to be separated
member.param: collection to which to apply the separation
minimum distance between two results (must be > 0)

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Collections.Generic.CollectionExtensions.SeparateBySize``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Double)
member.summary:
Makes sure the results in this list are separated by at least pixels (measured using the L1 norm). The separations is being carried out as follows:
First of all the list of results will be sorted by descending quality
Then the list will iterated from the element with the highest quality to the element with the lowest quality
For each element being iterated the distance to all subsequent list elements (i.e. those list elements with a lower quality) will be calculated; if it is less than the locality parameter, the element with the lower quality will be eliminated from the list
member.typeparam: type of the result comparable objects to be separated
member.param: collection to which to apply the separation
minimum distance between two results (must be > 0)

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.CompositeStreamBase.RegisterManagedFlowSetPool(System.Int32)
member.summary: Registers an internal flow-set pool.

remarks.para: Creates an internal flow-set pool with flow-sets. Any previously registered flow-set pool will be deregistered.
To reduce memory consumption call before this call as first the new memory is created to be exception safe.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.CompositeStreamBase.DeregisterFlowSetPool
member.summary: Removes an existing flow set pool from the acquisition engine.

remarks.para: This call is only allowed when the acquisition engine is not running.
Removing the flow set pool can be useful in between changes of to reduce memory.

member.summary: The types in the namespace Stemmer.Cvb.Driver expose part of the functionality covered by the CVCDriver.dll.
member.remarks: Definitions needed for device discovery, notification events and the use of video streams of different kinds as well as the definitions of the basic interfaces used in the CVCDriver.dll can be found here.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.BufferImage
member.summary: Stream image that is returned when no interface is available.

remarks.para: This behaves almost as a . The difference is that if the pixel buffer switches underneath, this image still points to the pixel buffer it was created on. The CvbMappedImage will point to the new location.
Switching pixel buffers commonly occurs on driver related s like the from the . If available on a , prefer the .

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamImage
member.summary: Base class of all stream related images.

remarks.para: A stream related image is returned from a grab synchronization method like . These kinds of images normally use an underlying ring buffer or a queue to reuse memory and increase performance. This then implies, that the validity of this image's data is limited according to the used acquisition engine / strategy.
By default, you expect images of this type to be valid from creation until the next synchronization / acquisition start.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamImage.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates the stream image and adopts its life-time.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamImage.RawTimestamp
member.summary: Gets the raw timestamp as reported by the driver.

remarks.para:
This value's unit depends on the driver used. Examples:
GenICam.vin
Device ticks (GigE Vision/USB3 Vision). Can be translated via either the GevTimestampTickFrequency GenApi or if that is not present the of the TimestampLatchValue IntegerNode (granularity in nanoseconds).
Teledyne Dalsa Drivers
Dependent on configuration file. By default microseconds.
CVSisoMe.vin
Grabber FPGA frequency ticks (One tick would be 16 nanoseconds with the me4 and 8 nanoseconds with the me5). Can also be microseconds...
CVAVT1394.vin
Unit is seconds with 125 microsecond granularity (bus frequency).
Video/Emu
Unit is milliseconds; for variable rate videos the timestamp value is guessed by its frame number and the current frame time.
Keep in mind that the value might wrap around (can be as fast as 128s when the CVAVT1394.vin is used).

member.value: Value with undefined unit (dependent on driver); if no timestamp is present at all.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.Stream.GetSnapshot
member.summary: Acquires a single image and returns it.

remarks.para: Attention: it is generally not possible to call this method while the acquisition has been started by or if an observer is ed.
Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.Stream.Wait
member.summary: Waits for indefinitely for the next acquired image and returns it.

remarks.para: Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.
The returned image is not necessary the newest. If more images where acquired since the last call to this method, the content is the oldest not collected image buffer by default.
You can also this wait call.

member.exception: This operation has been aborted via or .

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.Stream.Abort
member.summary: Stops the acquisition of images immediately.

remarks.para: This stops the acquisition as fast as possible interrupting the ongoing operation. This might result in partially acquired images.
If the underlying driver does not support this, this call behaves as if had been called.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.Stream.Subscribe(System.IObserver{Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamImage})
member.summary: Notifies this stream that the given is to receive new image notifications.

remarks.para: When subscribing to a stream which is not running (see ), this stream is ed. If this stream it runs by default until all images are delivered once. For endless streams it keeps running until all subscribed s are unsubscribed via the returned object or / is called. If one of these two functions is called or this stream , all subscribed s receive the notification.
If you wish to automatically loop s, you need to set to true.

The stream is kept running even if is called. Note, though, that if you use the reactive extensions (System.Reactive), they will unsubscribe in this case and you need to resetup your application. Thus if you use your own implementation you can handle it as you wish.
The acquisition loop is run in a long running and using . Thus there are no timeouts. Unsubscribing all s will result in being called.
Manually calling or is forbidden as long as there is at least one subscribed .

member.returns: Reference to an interface to allow stop receiving notifications (unsubscribe).

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.Stream.ObservableAcquisitionLoop
member.summary: This is the acquisition loop for d observers.
member.remarks: This method is executed in a long-running task scheduled on the default scheduler.

member.summary: Unsubscribes the given .

remarks.para: If the given is not subscribed, this method does nothing. After this call the will get no notifications anymore.
If the last is removed, is called.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.DeviceImage
member.summary: Special device image.

remarks.para: This image points to the image data that is currently processed. It is not necessary the newest acquired image. It points to the image buffer that is returned due to the last grab synchronization method (i.e. Wait method).

Use this image only in the same thread context in which you grab handling occurs. The object will stay the same, but the underlying buffer changes when the synchronization method returns successfully. If you need the image in a parallel context copy the image ()

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.EmuImage
member.summary: Image of a CVB emulation object.

remarks.para: This image points to the image data that is currently processed. It points to the image buffer that is returned due to the last grab synchronization method (i.e. method).

Use this image only in the same thread context in which your grab handling occurs. The object will stay the same, but the underlying buffer changes when the synchronization method return successfully. If you need the image in a parallel context either copy the image ().

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.EmuImage.#ctor(Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.EmuDevice)
member.summary: Creates the EmuImage.
member.remarks: No memory pressure is performed by this image as the device holds the memory.
member.param: Device object (and thus the image handle).

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IImageRect
member.summary: Image rectangle query and change operations.

remarks.para: With this interface you can configure the AOI that is streamed from the camera's sensor.
You can also use this interface to adjust CVB's buffers for incoming data according to the current device's settings.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IImageRect.SensorSize
member.summary: Full size of the sensor in pixels.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IImageRect.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset of the image rectangle from the top left corner of the sensor.

remarks.para: The set value may be adjusted according to the used hardware. To get the actual value you need to reread this offset after setting it.
Many devices support changing the offset while grab is active as the buffer size does not change.

member.value: The value range is 0 to . - . and 0 to . - . pixels.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IImageRect.Size
member.summary: Gets the size of the image rectangle.
member.remarks: Setting a new value results in new image buffers. Thus setting is only supported via either and methods.
member.value: Size of the image in pixels.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IImageRect.Update(Stemmer.Cvb.DeviceUpdateMode)
member.summary: Reads out the current image format data from the device and adjusts the streaming input buffer accordingly.

remarks.para: Calling this method is only possible if the acquisition not .
If you changed the image dimension or color format e.g. via the interface, you can update the image buffer via this call. This is necessary prior starting a new acquisition!
If you are unsure about the , simply use .

member.param: Defines how to handle device images.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IImageRect.ChangeSize(Stemmer.Cvb.Size2D,Stemmer.Cvb.DeviceUpdateMode)
member.summary: Sets a new size to the image rectangle and thus the streamed image.

remarks.para: Calling this method is only possible if the acquisition not .
The may be adjusted according to the used hardware. To get the actual value you need to read the after setting it.
Possible sizes are up to . - . and . - .
If you are unsure about the , simply use .

member.param: New size of the image rect in pixels.
Defines how to handle device images.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.ImageRect.Command.Set
member.summary: Sets the size or the offset but doesn't decrement the RefCount.

remarks.para: Attention: Be aware that the reference count of the input image is increased by one! You have to release the input image twice.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.RingBufferLockMode
member.summary: Lock mode options.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.RingBufferLockMode.Auto
member.summary: Buffer is automatically unlocked while streaming.
member.remarks: Traditional CVB behavior when you are using any of the acquisition interfaces.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.RingBufferLockMode.Off
member.summary: Buffers are not locked at all.
member.remarks: Images are simply written in the ring buffer and overwrite existing image data.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.RingBufferLockMode.On
member.summary: Buffer is locked after acquisition.
member.remarks: Has to be manually unlocked via method. If all buffers are locked the system looses images.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IRingBuffer.GetAcquisitionSequence
member.summary: Gets the sequence of ring buffer images in the order they were acquired.

remarks.para: Calling this method gives a snapshot of all acquired images based on the point in time when the last or related method was called.
The first entry in the list is thus the oldest waited upon image and the last one is the newest (the one returned by Wait).

member.returns: Array of RingBuffer indeces in acquisition order.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo
member.summary: Queryable information.
member.remarks: Attention: All streams only provide a sub-set of the available queries. So always make sure that the information is available when switching devices/drivers.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.IsCameraDetected
member.summary: Gets whether a camera is currently detected.

remarks.para: The value is interpreted as a C boolean: everything except 0 is true.
This information depends on the camera/frame grabber technology. It can be the presence of a signal from e.g. a CameraLink camera or an active heartbeat signal from a GigE Vision device.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersAcquired
member.summary: The number of images buffers acquired since start of the last acquisition.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersDelivered
member.summary: Number of image buffers successfully returned by the stream's wait method.
member.remarks: This counts both corrupt and complete image buffers. Corrupt images are only delivered if enabled by the driver (normally defaults to yes).

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersLost
member.summary: Count that incorporates all lost image buffers despite their reason. Can be transfer, corruption, or overflown ring buffer.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersLostTransfer
member.summary: Count that only contains lost images during transfer.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersLostLocked
member.summary: Count that only contains lost images due to ring buffer overflow.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersLocked
member.summary: Number of images currently in locked state.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersPending
member.summary: Number of images acquired, but not retrieved via the stream's wait method.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersCorruptOnArrival
member.summary: Count that contains erroneous image buffer acquisition.
member.remarks: Packet resend can alleviate this problem and result in complete buffer to be delivered via the stream's wait method. But higher counts indicate a bad connection either due to transfer errors or to high throughput.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersCorruptOnDelivery
member.summary: Count that contains erroneous image buffers delivered via the stream's wait method.
member.remarks: This count can only increase if corrupt images are delivered from the driver (default is yes). That means that either packet resend is disabled or packet resend could not complete the image buffer.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumTriggersLost
member.summary: Gets how many trigger signals where ignored by the device due to e.g. over-triggering.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersAnnounced
member.summary: Number of buffers used in the acquisition engine.
member.remarks: This is the number of images in the ring buffer.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersQueued
member.summary: Number of buffers available to be filled by the acquisition engine. I.e. image buffers that are not locked.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumBuffersBeingFilled
member.summary: Number of buffer currently being filled by the acquisition engine.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumPacketsReceived
member.summary: For packet based protocols this contains the actual number of packets received (parts of a whole image buffer).

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.StreamInfo.NumResends
member.summary: Number of resend requests sent since start of the last acquisition.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition
member.summary: Interface for all streaming devices

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.GetSnapshot
member.summary: Acquires a single image and returns it.

remarks.para: Waits infinitely for the image to be taken.
Attention: it is generally not possible to call this method while the acquisition has been started by .
Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.GetTimedSnapshot(Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.UsTimeSpan)
member.summary: Acquires a single image and returns it.

remarks.para: Waits for the given for the image to be taken.
Attention: it is generally not possible to call this method while the acquisition has been started by .
Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.

member.param: Time span to wait for (millisecond granularity).
member.exception: Most common exception: elapsed without receiving new image.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.GetTimedSnapshot(Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.UsTimeSpan,Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.WaitStatus@)
member.summary: Acquires a single image and returns it.

remarks.para: Waits for the given for the image to be taken.
Attention: it is generally not possible to call this method while the acquisition has been started by .
Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.
This method does not throw an exception when is exceeded; it will report this in the with . Other exceptions still might get thrown on error conditions.

member.param: Time span to wait for (millisecond granularity).
Variable to receive the status of this operation.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.Start
member.summary: Starts the acquisition of images.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.Wait
member.summary: Waits infinitely for the next acquired image and returns it.

remarks.para: Attention: it is generally not safe to call the wait method from different threads on the same object!
Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.
The returned image is not necessary the newest. If more images where acquired since the last call to this method, the content is the oldest not collected image buffer by default.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.Wait(Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.WaitStatus@)
member.summary: Waits infinitely for the next acquired image and returns it.

remarks.para: Attention: it is generally not safe to call the wait method from different threads on the same object!
Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.
The returned image is not necessary the newest. If more images where acquired since the last call to this method, the content is the oldest not collected image buffer by default.
This method does not throw an exception when the operation was ed; it will report this in the with . Other exceptions still might get thrown on error conditions.

member.param: Variable to receive the status of this operation.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.WaitFor(Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.UsTimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits for the given for the next acquired image.

remarks.para: Attention: it is generally not safe to call the wait method from different threads on the same object!
Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.
The returned image is not necessary the newest. If more images where acquired since the last call to this method, the content is the oldest not collected image buffer by default.

member.param: Time span to wait for (millisecond granularity).
member.exception: Most common exception: elapsed without receiving new image.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.WaitFor(Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.UsTimeSpan,Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.WaitStatus@)
member.summary: Waits for the given for the next acquired image.

remarks.para: Attention: it is generally not safe to call the wait method from different threads on the same object!
Dispose the returned when not needed anymore!

By default the returned image content is only guaranteed to stay unchanged until the next call to this method; afterwards the returned image is normally disposed. Thus it is normally not save to use this image in a display.
The returned image is not necessary the newest. If more images where acquired since the last call to this method, the content is the oldest not collected image buffer by default.
This method does not throw an exception when the operation was ed or did time out; it will report this in the with and respectively. Other exceptions still might get thrown on error conditions.

member.param: Time span to wait for (millisecond granularity).
Variable to receive the status of this operation.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.Stop
member.summary: Stops the acquisition of images.
member.remarks: This stops the acquisition gracefully letting the ongoing operation finish. The drawback of this might be that this call may take indefinite time if is used and no images are sent by the device.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.TryStop
member.summary: Tries to stop the acquisition of images.
member.remarks: Like it tries to halt gracefully with the same implications. This variant does not throw exceptions exception s.
member.returns: true on success; false on error.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.Abort
member.summary: Stops the acquisition of images immediately.

remarks.para: This stops the acquisition as fast as possible interrupting the ongoing operation. This might result in partially acquired images and either the being thrown or being signaled by the aborted method.
If the underlying driver does not support this, this call behaves as if had been called.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IAcquisition.TryAbort
member.summary: Tries to stop the acquisition of images immediately.
member.remarks: Like it stops as fast as possible with the same implications. This variant does not throw exceptions exception s.
member.returns: true on success; false on error.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.VinImage
member.summary: Image of a CVB Virtual Interface object.

remarks.para: This image points to the image data that is currently processed. It is not necessary the newest acquired image. It points to the image buffer that is returned due to the last grab synchronization method (i.e. method).

Use this image only in the same thread context in which your grab handling occurs. The object will stay the same, but the underlying buffer changes when the synchronization method return successfully. If you need the image in a parallel context either copy the image () or use the RingBufferImage in combination with LockMode.On. In the latter case you can unlock (dispose) the image when not needed anymore.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Driver.IDeviceSet
member.summary: Interface for sets.

remarks.para: A set contains a sorted list of unique entries.

These sets are a bit special as new instances are to be checked against present instances. This is necessary as different native objects can reference the same native device. With this API only one managed object of a device must be available at one point in time.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudFlags
member.summary: Flags for creating s.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudFlags.Float
member.summary: Create the point cloud with float components.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudFlags.Double
member.summary: Create the point cloud with double components.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudFlags.XYZ
member.summary: Create the point cloud with three Cartesian components (x, y, z).

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudFlags.XYZW
member.summary: Create the point cloud with four Cartesian, homogeneous components (x, y, z, w).

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudFlags.XYZConfidence
member.summary: Create point cloud with three Cartesian components (x, y, z) and a confidence plane.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudFlags.WithConfidence
member.summary: Create the point cloud with an additional confidence plane.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudFlags.NoExtrinsinc
member.summary: Only apply intrinsic calibration in .

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudFlags.NoMeshIndices
member.summary: Do not use directly: use to not load mesh information.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudLayout
member.summary: Supported point cloud layouts.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudLayout.Invalid
member.summary: No known / supported point cloud format.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudLayout.Linear
member.summary: No known buffer layout. For this layout only the plane roles X, Y and Z are known with their increments. Thus the PointCloud composite either has no buffer or no buffer that can be mapped via a PFNC value.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudLayout.SeparatePlanar
member.summary: Each plane is in its own, contiguous buffer. For each plane role X, Y and Z exists one distinct buffer. Increment to the next element is element sized as in a simple array. If the component data types are float, the composite has at least three buffers with PFNC values Coord3D_A32f, Coord3D_B32f and Coord3D_C32f.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudLayout.Planar
member.summary: All planes are in one planar, contiguous buffer. All plane roles X, Y and Z lay component wise one after the other. First all x, then all y and finally all z components. If the component data type is float, the composite has at least one buffer with a PFNC value of Coord3D_ABC32f_Planar.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.PointCloudLayout.Interleaved
member.summary: All points are stored x,y,z interleaved as in Point3D. All plane roles X, Y and Z lay point wise one after the other. If the component data type is float, the composite has at least one buffer with a PFNC value of Coord3D_ABC32f.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.FileFormat
member.summary: File format to store a point cloud in.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.FileFormat.Ascii
member.summary: ASCII text file with each point in one row.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.FileFormat.Ply
member.summary: PLY format for storing sparse point clouds and meshes.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.FileFormat.Stl
member.summary: STL format for storing sparse point clouds and meshes.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.FileFormat.WavefrontObj
member.summary: OBJ format for storing sparse point clouds and meshes.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.FileFormat.Tiff
member.summary: Custom TIFF format for storing sparse and dense point clouds.

member.summary: Remove every n-th points.

member.summary: Remove a specified amount of random points

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.GenApi.GenApiVersion
member.summary: Version information for GenICam related objects.
member.remarks:
The versions are managed as follows:
: An increase indicates a change which is not backward compatible.
: An increase indicates a change which adds new features. It must still support old versions of the server instance.
: An increase indicates a bug fix. No new features are added.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace and assembly Stemmer.Cvb holds all published definitions of the types that form Cvb.Net.
member.remarks: Directly underneath Stemmer.Cvb the functionality resident in the CVCImg.dll and CVCDriver.dll may be found in the form of the corresponding image and device types. Functionality implemented by other Image Manager DLLs (like CVCUtilities.dll or CVGenApi.dll) and Tools is located in the namespaces below Stemmer.Cvb.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.StopWatchMode
member.summary: Mode at which the StopWatch should work.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.StopWatchMode.MultiCPU
member.summary: The StopWatch works safe in multi-CPU environments. For that, some degree of accuracy is lost, because under Windows the timers, that are safe to use on a multi-CPU system, are limited to 1 ms granularity.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.StopWatchMode.SingleCPU
member.summary: The StopWatch works with a granularity of less than 1 ms (basically with what the Windows SDK function QueryPerformanceFrequency returns). However, a time generated with this mode will *not* be safe to use in a multi-CPU (not multi-core!) environment, because a thread may travel between CPUs and the timers are not synchronized between CPUs.

member.summary: Provides information about the CVB installation on your System.

member.summary: Maximum number of bytes to retrieve from the cached error strings.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.SystemInfo.GetLicenseInfo
member.summary: Get information about available licenses.
member.remarks: In theory, the collection of available licenses can change any time. However, it is fairly unlikely that during runtime someone unplugs a dongle or removes a Node Locked license, so Common Vision Blox does not implement a costly push/event model for notifying clients during runtime about the presence of new licenses or the loss of a license. Instead, the license information can and needs to be queried using this method.
member.returns: An array containing the currently available licenses.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.SystemInfo.WaitForLicense(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits until at least one license was found.
member.param: Maximum amount of time to wait.
member.returns: when licenses could be acquired, when the timeout was exceeded.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.SystemInfo.WaitForLicenseAsync(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits asynchronously until at least one license was found.
member.param: Maximum amount of time to wait.
member.returns: Task containing the result. when licenses could be acquired, when the timeout was exceeded.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.SystemInfo.GetMagicNumberEntries
member.summary: Query the set of currently available Magic Numbers.
member.remarks: In theory, the collection of available Magic Numbers can change any time. However, it is fairly unlikely that during runtime someone unplugs a dongle or removes a Node Locked license, so Common Vision Blox does not implement a costly push/event model for notifying clients during runtime about the presence of new Magic Numbers or the loss of a Magic Number. Instead, the Magic Number information can and needs to be queried using this method.
member.returns: An array containing the currently available magic number entries.

If the version id of your CVB installation has been corrupted

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Utilities.SystemInfo.DefaultTimeout
member.summary: Default timeout setting to be used by drivers.
member.remarks: Note that for setting this property administrative privileges are required, which means that the application must have been started using "Launch as Administrator" on Windows Vista or 7 if UAC is enabled, otherwise an exception will occur. A default timeout of 10 seconds will be returned in case the timeout can not be read from registry.
member.exception: If the default timeout could not be written to the registry
When trying to set this property while the application that tries to set the property does not have administrative privileges.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.DeviceFactory.Discover
member.summary: Discovers available devices (not vins) with a default time span of 300ms.

remarks.para: This method behaves like the CVB Management Console when discovering devices: It lists all GenICam devices (like GigE Vision and USB3 Vision) and filters out the STEMMER IMAGING Socket Driver devices for GigE Vision (only shows Filter Driver devices).
This method does not throw a if the wait time is exceeded: it just waits for the time span. If a device answers after this span it is not in the returned list.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Image.Save(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Write the current content of the image into a file. The file format to be used is determined based on the 's extension. The quality (and thereby size) of the resulting file can be adjusted using the parameter. When saving to a lossless file format, the parameter will be silently ignored.
member.param: File name into which to save the image
Quality at which to save the image (should be in the range 0...1)
member.exception: If this image has already been disposed

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Image.BeginPixelContentChange
member.summary: Starts an image update block.

remarks.para: Normally API operations changing this image will result in an immediate event. If several updates are performed they can be grouped together so that only one event is fired after the full block.
Several blocks can also be nested. The event will then fired when the last block is closed.

member.summary: Ends an image update block.
member.remarks: See for additional information.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Image.System#ICloneable#Clone
member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.

remarks.para: This method performs a deep copy of the image data the current instance currently points to.
This means that if you clone a driver image, you receive a new plain without any driver interfaces!

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.DeviceUpdateMode
member.summary: Defines how to treat the optional device image, when the device itself is updated.

remarks.para: A method containing this as a parameter indicates a change. This invalidates the old handle in a way that no s are available anymore. The only thing remaining is the old ring buffer, but only with access to the last synchronized buffer.
If a method call containing this as a parameter succeeds it is necessary for the client application to update the in objects, that only use handle.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.DeviceUpdateMode.UpdateDeviceImage
member.summary: Updates the handle of any existing device image.

remarks.para: If unsure use this as the default.

The result of this operation is that the currently active device image is moved to the new device image internally. The result is that the current image buffer is lost and replaced by an empty/black buffer.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.DeviceUpdateMode.NewDeviceImage
member.summary: Creates a new device image keeping the old one intact.

remarks.para: Use this option if you still do processing on the old image data while performing the switch operation.

Attention: If you bound the old device image to a display or used it in another control to always access the current image data, keep in mind that you need to assign the new device image of the device manually.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Device.Handle
member.summary: Gets the native CVB object handle.
member.remarks: It is normally not necessary to work with this handle in CVB.Net. Note that using this handle in connection with the legacy CVB managed wrappers may actually be disruptive to your application.

member.name: E:Stemmer.Cvb.Device.HandleChange
member.summary: Fired if the native changes due to an operation.

remarks.para: You only need to register to this event if you are working directly with the native handle and assigned it to another object.
When this event is being fired, the change is in the middle of the process: all internal management has been changed (including the device ), but the old handle is still pointing to a valid object.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Device.ChangeHandle(System.IntPtr,Stemmer.Cvb.DeviceUpdateMode)
member.summary: Changes the handle of this device.

remarks.para: This method will fire the event and release the old handle afterwards. So if you need it otherwise, share it natively.
Always call the parent implementation if overriding this method to actually exchange the handle.

member.param: New handle to use in this device.
Information how to handle device images, if any is present.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.HighBitScaleMode
member.summary: Defines the mode that is being used for scaling high bit images (more than 8 bits per pixel) to an 8 bit display.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.HighBitScaleMode.Default
member.summary: Default treatment applies the mode to 8 bit images and the mode otherwise.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.HighBitScaleMode.Global
member.summary: Apply global scaling (i.e. use the global maximum and minimum value of the source data type to scale to 8 bits). This mode cannot be used on images with floating point valued pixels; if an image with floating point pixels is encountered, the mode will be used instead.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.HighBitScaleMode.ViewPort
member.summary: Scale according to the local view port: The view port is being searched for the minimum and maximum pixel value, and the pixel values that are currently visible (i.e. inside the view port) will be scaled to the full range of 0...255.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.HighBitScaleMode.WrapAround
member.summary: Display images with > 8 bits per pixel by limiting the display to the lowest 8 bits. This is not a particularly beautiful display mode for high bit images because it will show extreme contrasts where that 8 bit wrap around happens, but it used to be the only display mode in the CVB display.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.MappedImage
member.summary: A mapped Common Vision Blox image.

remarks.para: A mapped image does not own the image data, but references the image data of another image's plane.
With a mapped image you can cheaply create different views on one or several images. So be careful when writing to the pixel data of a mapped image.

member.summary: Wraps, without copying, the given pixel buffer in a .

remarks.para: The number of planes is deduced from the length of the array.
This method does not add memory pressure as the memory is managed elsewhere.

member.param: Pointer to the start of the pixel buffer.
Width of the image in pixels.
Height of the image in pixels.
Distance in bytes between two neighbouring pixels of the same plane, i.e. 1 for normal Mono8 images.
Distance in bytes between two neighbouring lines of the same plane, i.e. + optional padding for Mono8 images.
Distance in bytes between two neighbouring infos, i.e. 1 for an interleaved RGB8 image.
Defines the mapping between the plane layout and the logical CVB infos (R/G/B by default), i.e. (0,1,2) for an RGB8 image and (2,1,0) for a BGR8 image.

member.param: Pointer to the start of the pixel buffer.
Width of the image in pixels.
Height of the image in pixels.
Distance in bytes between two neighbouring pixels of the same plane, i.e. 1 for normal Mono8 images.
Distance in bytes between two neighbouring lines of the same plane, i.e. + optional padding for Mono8 images.
Distance in bytes between two neighbouring infos, i.e. 1 for an interleaved RGB8 image.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.DataType.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of this data type.
member.remarks:
The following prefixes are available:
fFloating point image. sSigned integer image. cpComplex packed image.
If no prefix is displayed it is an unsigned integer image. The postfix '(o)' means that the image uses an overlay bit.
member.returns: Short string representation of the data type.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Transformations
member.summary: Container class for a selection of functions that perform a (non-geometric) transformation on the input image.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Transformations.CreateOverlayCapableCopy(Stemmer.Cvb.Image)
member.summary: Creates a copy of the input image that is guaranteed to be overlay capable. If the input image already is an overlay-capable image, the input image will simply be copied (preserving all overlay information). Otherwise a new image with the overlay flag set will be generated and receive a copy of the input image, but all the overlay bits will be set to zero.
member.param: Image of which to create an overlay capable copy.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.Transformations.CreateOverlayFreeCopy(Stemmer.Cvb.Image)
member.summary: Creates a copy of the input image that does not have the overlay flag set. If the input image already is a non-overlay image, the input image will simply be copied (preserving the information in bit 0). Otherwise a new image with the overlay bits removed (= set to 0) will be generated and returned.
member.param: Image of which to create a non-overlay capable copy.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb._DrawMode.Or
member.summary: Bit-Or draw mode.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.ImagePlane.Vpat
member.summary: Accesses the virtual pixel access table.
member.remarks: Normally this property only needs to be accessed if you want to access the underlying CVB image on the pixel level. Note that VPAT access is one of the slower access modes. If possible, linear access is preferred.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.ImagePlane.TryGetLinearAccess(Stemmer.Cvb.LinearAccessData@)
member.summary: Attempt a linear access on the plane's pixels.
member.remarks: This function scans the image's VPAT for the possibility to access the individual pixels with linear increments in x and y direction. If either of the VPATs are jumbled, it will return false, otherwise the values in can be used to calculate the address of each pixel.
member.param: Data structure receiving the values for accessing the pixels
member.returns: true if linear access is possible, false otherwise.
member.exception: If Parent has already been disposed

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.ImagePlane.TryGetLinearAccess``1(Stemmer.Cvb.LinearAccessData{``0}@)
member.summary: Attempt a typed linear access on the plane's pixels.

remarks.para: This function scans the image's VPAT for the possibility to access the individual pixels with linear increments in x and y direction. If either of the VPATs are jumbled, it will return false, otherwise the values in can be used to calculate the address of each pixel.
Additionally the size of T must be equal to the .
Attention: Do not use reference types in T as this will leak memory!

member.typeparam: Structure for access a single plane's pixel.

member.name: M:Stemmer.Cvb.ImagePlane.GetLockedAccess(Stemmer.Cvb.ImageDataLockMode)
member.summary: Gets thread-locked access to the image data.

remarks.para: Calling this method will enter a reader/writer lock based on the specified lock mode. It is mandatory to the returned object when pixel access has finished. Best use the returned object in a using block.

All other API functions do not use the reader/writer lock of the image. Thus if you want to use these on a shared image resource with some write access, you need to wrap the calls in a using block initialized by this method.
Also by giving a hint whether you are changing the image data, the event is fired when the returned object is disposed and the is or .

member.summary: VPAT is mixed up, increments are not linearly arranged.

member.name: F:Stemmer.Cvb.VpatLayout.LinearWithDataType
member.summary: VPAT is linear and uses an increment that matches the data type of the image.
member.remarks: That means the delta from one pixel to the next in x direction is exactly the number of bytes occupied by one pixel or the delta from one pixel to the next in y direcction is exactly width * bytes per pixel). Note that this will never be the case for interleaved multi planar images.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Vpat.Rotation
member.summary: Guesses the rotation of this VPAT.
member.remarks: The assumption about the underlying buffer is that it is positively linear (positive x- and y-increments). If this is not the case as with default windows bitmaps, the guess is plain wrong.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Vpat.XEntry
member.summary: X offset table.
member.remarks: VPAT access is returned as IntPtr with this indexer, giving you the correct size of offsets for the platform you are running on, but making it necessary to properly convert the offsets when doing calculations.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Vpat.YEntry
member.summary: Y offset table.
member.remarks: VPAT access is returned as IntPtr with this indexer, giving you the correct size of offsets for the platform you are running on, but making it necessary to properly convert the offsets when doing calculations.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Vpat.IntXEntry
member.summary: X offset table.
member.remarks: VPAT access is returned as Int32 with this indexer. Note that it is only safe to use this indexer if your application is running as a 32 bit application.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Vpat.IntYEntry
member.summary: Y offset table.
member.remarks: VPAT access is returned as Int32 with this indexer. Note that it is only safe to use this indexer if your application is running as a 32 bit application.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Vpat.LongXEntry
member.summary: X offset table.
member.remarks: VPAT access is returned as Int64 with this indexer. This indexer is safe to use for 32 or 64 bit applications, but may increase processing time.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Vpat.LongYEntry
member.summary: Y offset table.
member.remarks: VPAT access is returned as Int64 with this indexer. This indexer is safe to use for 32 or 64 bit applications, but may increase processing time.

member.name: P:Stemmer.Cvb.Vpat.BasePtr

member.remarks: Note that this is not necessarily a pointer to the first pixel in the image or the first pixel in the last line of the image, but merely a base pointer for calculating the address of a pixel using the x and y offset tables.

member.name: T:Stemmer.Cvb.Rect
member.summary: Cvb Rectangle structure.

remarks.para: Unlike System.Drawing.Rectangle, which upholds the convention that Right and Bottom are not part of the rectangle (in other words: Width = Left - Right and Height = Bottom - Top), Common Vision Blox always uses rectangles (or rectangular shaped areas of interest represented by integer parameters left, top, right and bottom) in such a way that right and bottom are still part of the area to be investigated (i.e. Width = Right - Left + 1 and Height = Bottom - Top + 1).
To model this difference correctly we decided to give CVB.Net a rectangle of its own which behaves according to the conventions used in Common Vision Blox.
